As the marketing manager at the construction company, I was tasked with promoting our new housing complex that was being developed using a revolutionary but untested material system. This material was unlike anything seen before in the construction industry, with properties that made it both innovative and challenging to work with.

The material was described as 'wartungsintensiv' (maintenance-intensive), meaning that it required regular upkeep to ensure its longevity. Despite this drawback, it had the potential to be a game-changer in the industry due to its ability to adapt to environmental changes and react autonomously. It could passively change its form in response to external factors, making it both intelligent and multifunctional.
